definitions.title: n.pr.loc.
definitions.body: Astarwq, etc., E. of Jordan (name from worship of diff. forms of ‘Aštart; in Egypt. ‘astiratu, as E. Jordan loc. WMM:As. u. Eur. 162, 313; cf. TelAm. n.pr.loc. Aštarti);—in Bashan (near Edrei) De 1:4 ([[רׂת]]-), Jos 12:4, Jos 13:12, Jos 13:31 (all + [[אֶדְרֶ֫עִי]]), Jos 9:10, 1Ch 6:56 = [[בְּעֶשְׁתְּרָה]] (i.e. [[בֵּית עַשְׁתָּרָה]]) Jos 21:27; also [[עַשְׁתְּרׂת]] [[קַרְנַיִם]] Ge 14:5 (LXX Astarwq Karnain, cf. GFM:JBL xvi(1897), 155 f. who expl. name as Ashtereth of the two-peaked mt:); cf. further, [[קַרְנַיִם]] Am 6:13; md; site prob. either Tel ‘ Aštara, 21 miles E. of Sea of Galilee, or Muzeirib, 8 miles further S.; poss. both occur in OT; cf. esp. Dr:Ashtaroth in Hast:DB Di:Gn 14, 5), Buhl:Georg. 248 ff. GASm:Ency. Bib. 335 f.
